title: Bernardo Silva given more time to respond to FA charge over controversial Benjamin Mendy tweet
text:
Bernardo Silva has been granted an extension by the Football Association to respond to his misconduct charge over a controversial tweet about Manchester City team-mate, Benjamin Mendy.

The City playmaker had been given until Wednesday to reply after he invited accusations of racial stereotyping after posting an image of Mendy as a child next to a picture of a mascot for a Spanish chocolate peanut brand.

The mascot is black and has large, red lips and Bernardo’s tweet - which was accompanied by the words “Guess Who?” - drew condemnation from the anti-racism charity, Kick It Out.

But Bernardo and City submitted an application to the chairman of the FA’s judicial panel requesting more time to respond to the charge owing to the player’s international commitments with Portugal over the next week.

Portugal are due to play Euro 2020 qualifying matches against Luxembourg in Lisbon on Friday and Ukraine in Kiev three days later.
